definition.name: Configure GitHub Pages
definition.description: A GitHub Action to enable Pages, extract various metadata about a site, and configure some supported static site generators.
definition.author: GitHub

inputs.name: static_site_generator
inputs.description: Optional static site generator to attempt to configure: "nuxt", "next", "gatsby", or "sveltekit"

inputs.name: generator_config_file
inputs.description: Optional file path to static site generator configuration file

inputs.name: enablement
inputs.description: Try to enable Pages for the repository if it is not already enabled. This option requires a token other than `GITHUB_TOKEN` to be provided. In the context of a Personal Access Token, the `repo` scope or Pages write permission is required. In the context of a GitHub App, the `administration:write` and `pages:write` permissions are required.

outputs.name: base_url
outputs.description: GitHub Pages site full base URL. Examples: "https://octocat.github.io/my-repo", "https://octocat.github.io", "https://www.example.com"

outputs.name: base_path
outputs.description: GitHub Pages site full base path. Examples: "/my-repo" or ""

evidence.reasoning: This action is primarily focused on deploying static sites to GitHub Pages, which falls under the Deployment category. It also involves configuring metadata and supporting static site generators, linking it to Documentation and Infrastructure.
